sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken arrives in Israel as UNICEF warns of the dire situation of children in Gaza.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken arriving in Tel Aviv on Monday evening.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He's due to brief Israeli leaders today on his two days of talks with Arab leaders in U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken arriving in Tel Aviv on Monday evening.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He's due to brief Israeli leaders today on his two days of talks with Arab leaders in the region as he attempts to prevent Israel's war against Hamas from exploding into a broader conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: In New York, the newly appointed U.N. Humanitarian Reconstruction Coordinator for Gaza, Sigrid Kach, has met with the Secretary General Antonio Guterres. She will facilitate and coordinate humanitarian relief consignments. And UNICEF says it's deeply concerned about the high levels of malnutrition and disease threatening the lives of over 1 million children in the Palestinian enclave, with cases of diarrhea increasing at an alarming rate. We are here receiving 600,000 doses of routine vaccination, very, very critical for the life and the well-being of children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: We do not want to see children who survived the bombing to die because they are not vaccinated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And in Israel, portraits of the victims of Hamas's deadly 7th of October attack on the Tribe of Novo music festival. Families have been visiting the site in the Negev desert where more than 360 people were killed and others were taken hostage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: As they walked between the photos and flags, trance music played in the background.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Some 3,000 people gathering outside the European Commission office in the Polish capital Warsaw on Monday evening.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: They were calling on the EU to provide much-needed support and weapons to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: It was organized by the Euromaidan Warsaw Initiative.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile in Berlin, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz auf die Europäischen Staaten geruft, die Unterstützung für die Ukraine zu steigern. And in Ukraine, soldiers in the Kharkiv region have urged the world not to forget their war against Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He says they are continuing to fight despite the harsh winter conditions. President of the European Council Charles Michel's announcement that he is ending his

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: mandate earlier than expected to run for European elections has raised some eyebrows in Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: A prominent Dutch MEP, Sophie Indveld, from the same centrist liberal political family as Michel, wrote on social media that Michel was acting like a captain leaving his ship in the middle of a storm. When asked by Euronews, expert Alberto Alemano said Michel's decision was selfish. So in a way, this is really terra incognita, is a new area, a new space for the European leaders, which Michel is actually doing just to pursue his own self-interest. It's certainly not in the interest of the European Union to have him end his political mandate before his natural term, which would have been November 2024. According to EU law, if a replacement for the EU Council presidency is not found in time, the position will go to whoever is next in rotation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: In theory, this could mean the key position could land in the hands of Hungary's Eurosceptic Prime Minister Viktor Orban, who is due to hold the EU's rotating presidency from July.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But it appears much more likely that by then European leaders will find a replacement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Most likely, in my interpretation, will be a temporary interim replacement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Somebody who is going to cover the natural ending of this mandate of Mr. Michel from, let's say, June to November.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And then as a part of the package of the new European top jobs, a new name will be identified.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: the package of the new European top jobs, a new name will be identified.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Sources close to Charles Michel told journalists that EU leaders could eventually find his successor in June, right after the elections, or they could change the rules to find a successor for the interim period.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: German farmers blocked the main motorway access roads in some parts of the country on Monday. It's the start of a week of protests against the government plan to eliminate tax benefits for farmers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: In Berlin, hundreds of tractors blocked the main access to the Brandenburg Gate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Protests planned for the next seven days include rallies that will disrupt traffic in several regions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Farmers are promising to block the roads for the next eight days despite the German government revising the 2024 budget that sparked these protests in the first place.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The changes will see agricultural diesel subsidies reduced over the next two years before ending in 2026.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: But farmers say this is not enough. über die nächsten zwei Jahre reduziert, bevor es im Jahr 2026 endet. Aber die Landwirte sagen, dass das nicht genug ist. Die Regierungskoalition, die von Chancellor Olaf Scholz geführt wurde, hat die Landwirte im letzten Monat mit Plänen, die Fahrtax-Exemption für agrarische Fahrzeuge und Taxi-Bremsen auf Diesel-Fuhrzeugen, tax breaks on diesel fuel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The snow and extreme cold in Europe continue to complicate life for thousands of citizens throughout the continent, north and south.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Sweden recorded minus 43.6 degrees Celsius, its lowest temperature since 1999, while in Denmark temperatures have dropped to minus 20 degrees, causing traffic disruption.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This morning Danish car assistance companies received inquiries from more than 2,000 motorists who needed help.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: There have been traffic accidents in several places.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Snow and sub-zero temperatures on Monday also caused another day of disruption across Moldova, prompting authorities in the capital to close schools and suspend public transport.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Police have also warned drivers to take caution after assisting vehicles that veered off the roads amid the icy conditions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Convicted mass murderer Anders Breivik appeared in court on Monday in a second attempt to sue the Norwegian state for allegedly breaching his human rights.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Breivik, a right-wing extremist who killed 77 people in a deadly rampage, appeared before a judge in Oslo, claiming his solitary confinement since being imprisoned in 2012 amongst the inhumane treatment under the European Convention of Human Rights.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A similar claim during a case in 2016 was accepted, but later overturned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: On the 22nd of July 2011, Breivik killed eight people in a bomb attack in Oslo before heading to a youth camp on Utøya Island, where, dressed as a police officer, he stalked and gunned down 69 more, mostly teenagers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He has shown no remorse for his attacks, which he portrayed as a crusade against multiculturalism in Norway.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: way. In a foreign policy speech on Monday, Pope Francis called for a universal ban on surrogacy,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: which he called a despicable practice and a serious violation of the dignity of women and children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: In his speech, the Pope went on to say a child is a gift that should not be transformed into an object of trafficking and should not be, in his words, the basis of commercial exploitation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: The Pope gave the speech on foreign policy to the ambassadors accredited to the Holy Sea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We have ignition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: NASA launched its first rocket to the moon in over 50 years on Monday morning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Launching a new era in spaceflight to the moon and beyond.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: The Peregrine lander, carried on United Launch Alliance's Vulcan rocket, is also the first ever launch by a private company.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Peregrine has been contracted by NASA to carry five scientific instruments. These will study the moon's surface environment ahead of human missions later this decade.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The buzziest city in the world just got a lot noisier. The tech community is in Las Vegas for CES, the Consumer Electronics Show.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Thousands of tech companies will be spread out across the equivalent of 43 football fields.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And the big topic everywhere this year is artificial intelligence, used by this company, which monitors your health via a selfie.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Our AI is a big part of this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: So we're actually using what we call effective AI.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Effective AI, what we're doing is we're taking physiological and psychological biomarkers and we're using that to basically understand your health condition in real time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: AI is also being used in space.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The AI is very important because since we are working, first of all, with the astronauts, the AI is going to collect the data.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Our main and huge step is that we are preparing an AI as a psychologist for astronauts for Mars.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Back on Earth, governments are trying to wrangle how to regulate AI to protect our data.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: What we're advocating for in the United States, because we are a US-Canadian organization, is that we need to be Goldilocks with the three bears.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The Porsche has to be just right.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: You have to balance privacy against innovation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: We have to welcome change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: We have to be willing to pivot.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And those companies and countries which do that will be the winners.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The CES will also showcase all the latest gadgets, from the world's first ski skates to the tech you take home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This massager is not just massaging the body, but it also strengthens my core because it has the first technology to move my two legs independently.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Such technology will be widely available at CES this year, which expects to see 130,000 attendees.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This is Pascale Davies reporting for Euronews in Las Vegas.
